intro: Koehneola repens, commonly known as the creeping koehneola, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with slender stems that root at the nodes. Its small, five-petaled flowers are typically pink or white, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Koehneola repens is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions.
